title.narrative: Heard Voices: Promoting freedom of expression practices among children, young adults & youth

description.narrative: Promoting Freedom of Expression Practices Among Children, Young Adult and Youth. The project intends to enabling (360) children aged 4-6 years old and (210) parents to participate in interactive and expressive activities such as expressive storytelling & drama sessions in order to increase the kindergarten children s understanding of their rights and be able to express themselves. Children will have access to drama workshops to express their opinions, practice their rights through drama in an enabling learning environment. Parents will be engaged in parent-child based activities to increase the kindergarten children & parents understanding of children rights to express themselves, and participate in interactive interventions with children, parents and educators in order to apply children ideas of change on the play and learning environment within Al Hekayat Kindergarten. In addition to that, about (270) young adults aged 12 to 18 years old and (135) youth aged 19 to 30 will have access to expressive activities at NAWA through promoting young adults and youth expression of their opinions. Through this project, NAWA will be able to empower young adults and youth, and enhance their expressive capacities through culture, arts, education and technology interventions.
